results.title: To climb a mountain
results.creator_credit: Dennis Passaggio, BFA Educational Media and Ted Abenheim
results.brief_description: Shows how blindness is a handicap that can be overcome. Presents a story about a young man and woman and a group of their friends who successfully climb a mountain. Explores their feelings about their accomplishments as blind people and examines the attitudes of society about blindness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Passaggio, BFA Educational Media and Ted Abenheim

results.title: To Chapultepec = A Chapultepec
results.brief_description: This film provides some cultural background to Mexico, especially Chapultepec to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “Entender Y Hablar”. This is a spanish language film that includes new words which describe what four young people do in the city for fun. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: To catch a trout
results.creator_credit: Wilf Gray and Wilf Gray Film Productions
results.brief_description: Lakes in British Columbia are scientifically stocked and trout population controlled by the Fisheries Authority. Surveys are carried out to monitor the ecological balance of the lakes.

results.title: To Catch a thief
results.brief_description: The French Riviera serves as the picturesque backdrop for this classic, suspenseful Hitchcock caper with Cary Grant as John Robie, a reformed cat burglar once known as “The Cat”, suspected in a new wave of jewel thefts from luxury hotels. Meeting pampered heiress Frances (Grace Kelly at her most ravishing), he sees the chance to bait the mysterious thief with her mothers’ (Jessie Royce Landis) fabulous jewels and clear himself of suspicion. His plan backfires, but Frances, who believes him guilty, proves her love by helping him escape and in a spine-tingling climax, the real criminal is exposed. Script including the much-imitated fireworks scene by John Michael Hayes. The cinematography by Robert Burks won the Oscar for Best Cinematography, 1954. Co-starring John Williams, Charles Vanel, Brigitte Auber, Jean Martinelli and Georgette Anys. Based on the novel by David Dodge.

results.title: To be or not to be (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Brooksfilms, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Alan Johnson
results.brief_description: Mel Brooks’ hilarious remake of the Lubitsch comedy classic about a Polish theatre troupe which gets caught up in Hitler’s invasion of Poland. Brooks and Anne Bancroft play the lead actors in the troupe who are forever trying to gain the limelight from each other. When they become involved in a wild plot to threaten the Nazis, their battles become even more comic. The great cast includes Tim Matheson, Jose Ferrer and Charles Durning.

results.title: To Be or Not to Be
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Alexander Korda and Ernst Lubitsch
results.brief_description: A Warsaw theatre group, before and during the Nazi invasion, wages war on Hitler on a devious new battleground - the Shakespearean stage. The actors improvise an underground plot and an impersonation of invading Nazis, including Adolf Hitler. Stars Jack Benny, Robert Stack and Carole Lombard in her final performance.

results.title: To be a toolmaker
results.brief_description: The term “toolmaker” in enginerring does not mean the maker of ordinary hand tools such as hammers and screwdrivers. The film illustrates this fact by showing the operation of the special tools that make coins. It shows the production of other special tools, drill jigs, press tools, multi-progression tools and gauges. The film shows the progress of a would-be toolmaker and describes the type of work and training that an apprentice does in an engineering works and also at apprentice classes in a technical college.
